author: v1rtl
content:
Not sure if this is the right channel, but here's a question

Why is EIP-712 not an ERC? It's not an improvement to Ethereum itself but a standard on top of it, similar to ERCs

author: sky.cactus
content: It is an ERC.  Historically, all ERCs were EIPs.  At some point people started calling contract standards ERCs, but they were still part of the EIP process and given an EIP number.  People just called them "ERC-712" instead of "EIP-712" even those meant the same thing.  More recently, the EIP and ERC repositories were split I believe, so now there are actually two separate processes, but 712 came before that.

author: v1rtl
content:
when searchingly for "erc 712" this pops up

https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-712

can't find it in ERCs either:

https://github.com/ethereum/ERCs/tree/master/ERCS

author: sky.cactus
content: That is the correct link (first one).  I don't think older ERCs were migrated to the new ERC repository.

author: frangio_
content:
they were. EIP-712 is not in ERC category. it's under Standards Track > Interfaces (as opposed to Standards Track > ERC)

i believe EIP editors consider it a mistake that it wasn't published in ERC category
